title: Honeycrisp apples went from marvel to mediocre
dot: digraph HoneycrispAppleJourney{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgray, fontname="Arial", fontsize=10]subgraph cluster_origins{label="Origins and Rise to Stardom";style=dashed;A1[label="1983: David Bedford tastes MN1711 apple", fillcolor=lightyellow]A2[label="Cross between Keepsake and MN1627 varieties", fillcolor=lightyellow]A3[label="1991: Honeycrisp released to public", fillcolor=lightyellow]A4[label="Consumers attracted by crisp texture and flavor", fillcolor=lightyellow]A5[label="Honeycrisp becomes Minnesota state fruit", fillcolor=lightyellow]}subgraph cluster_popularity{label="Spread and Popularity";style=dashed;B1[label="Honeycrisp becomes popular in Midwest", fillcolor=lightblue]B2[label="Exclusively seasonal from September to February", fillcolor=lightblue]B3[label="Increased demand due to scarcity", fillcolor=lightblue]B4[label="Eventually planted in New York and Washington", fillcolor=lightblue]B5[label="By 2017: 13% of Washingtonâ€™s apple acreage", fillcolor=lightblue]}subgraph cluster_challenges{label="Challenges in Growing and Storing";style=dashed;C1[label="Honeycrisp difficult to grow in warm climates", fillcolor=lightgreen]C2[label="Prone to bitter pit, sunburn, and soft scald", fillcolor=lightgreen]C3[label="Labor-intensive harvesting process", fillcolor=lightgreen]C4[label="Takes 7-10 months in storage, affecting quality", fillcolor=lightgreen]C5[label="Sunburn, tissue collapse from exposure", fillcolor=lightgreen]}subgraph cluster_decline{label="Overproduction and Decline in Quality";style=dotted;D1[label="Oversupply of Honeycrisp apples by 2024", fillcolor=lightcoral]D2[label="Quality drops, apples no longer meet early expectations", fillcolor=lightcoral]D3[label="National average price drops to $1.70 per lb", fillcolor=lightcoral]D4[label="Honeycrisp becomes a commodity", fillcolor=lightcoral]}A1->A2->A3->A4->A5 A4->B1->B2->B3->B4->B5 C1->C2->C3->C4->C5 B5->D1->D2->D3->D4}
